events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle on the highway during heavy traffic.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and the customer's description of the incident.
An insurance agent was assigned to handle the customer's auto accident claim and begin the process of assistance.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been officially acknowledged by the insurance company.
The insurance company requested police reports, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and any witness statements related to the car accident.
The customer submitted all required documents, including the police report and photos of the vehicle damage for the investigation.
The claims department began investigating the details of the auto accident claim based on the submitted materials.
Investigation concluded confirming the customer was not at fault and damage is consistent with the reported collision.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs of the vehicle and any related expenses from the auto accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling and clear communication regarding the settlement proposal.
The insurance claim was officially approved for the agreed settlement amount to cover damages from the collision.
Payment was issued to the customerâ€™s repair shop to cover damages, closing the financial aspect of the auto accident claim.
Following payment issuance and customer confirmation, the auto accident claim was officially closed in the system.
The claim documents and records for the auto accident case were archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
